    Visual Studio Code

    Installation

    1. Download and install the IDE Visual Studio Code

    2. Download and install the latest version of PlatformIO.

    3. If you are a VS Code beginner, read the quick start guide

    4. Create a new PlatformIO project (use the home button in VS Codes purple status bar)
      • Board: Espressif ESP 32 Dev Module
      • Framework: Arduino Framework

    5. Wait for VSCode setting up your project.

    6. Change content of platformio.ini to 
      [env:esp32dev]
platform = https://github.com/platformio/platform-espressif32.git#eff0222cd1ce270a9c5f6d183e6e240f5e5cd458
board = esp32dev
framework = arduino
lib_deps = bloeckchengrafik/ftSwarm

    Writing Code

    Start writing your code. Use the following elements of the blue statusbar:

    • opens platformIO home.
    • builds your software.
    • uploads/flashes your software.
    • cleans up your cached files.
    • opens the serial monitor.
    • opens a terminal.
    • switches between your projects.


    Write your first application: motor&switch
